alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Kershaw; Lancaster (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 5:02AM EST until further notice by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Carolina... Congaree River At Congaree National Park-Gadsden affecting Calhoun and Richland Counties. Congaree River At Carolina Eastman affecting Calhoun, Lexington and Richland Counties. Pee Dee River At Cheraw affecting Chesterfield and Marlboro Counties. Enoree River At Whitmire affecting Union and Newberry Counties. Wateree River At Lake Wateree affecting Fairfield, Lancaster and Kershaw Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wateree River at Lake Wateree. * WHEN...From Wednesday evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 100.4 feet, The piers on the Wildlife Road bridge over Singleton Creek become submerged. At 102.5 feet, Roadways near Beaver Creek become flooded. At 103.0 feet, Home owners on low lying property have to move belongings out of basements or from under raised houses. Boat launch on U.S. Highway 1 at the lake closed due to flood water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 97.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 100.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow evening and continue rising to a crest of 101.6 feet early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 100.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don`t drown. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 515 PM EST.
